head.p: to: will@gmail.com from: smith@gmail.com RE: problem of racism in the USA

p.s: I've read an article on racism in the US here in Germany.
The article is published by the well-known newspaper Zeit on 25th August 2014 and written by Alexandra Endres.
After reading THUGThe Hate U Give in English class I was wondering wetherwhether racism is really a topical problem in the USA or in what extent everyone is experiencing it in the US.
The author begins with talking about Michael Brown and that he was shot two weekweeks ago in Ferguson by a police officer.
She says that this is an example on segregation in the US.
Endres has the opinion, that the prejudice to afro-americansAfro-Americans is happening, because black citizens are way often stopped and controlled by the police.
Today, she says, white people have it way better than afro-americansAfro-Americans although discrimination is forbidden since the Civil Rights Act 50 years ago.
Another reason to this is, she tells, that in comparison to whites black people don't get a school diploma that often.
And even if they finish school and their education they continue to study or go to college lesser than white people.
Statistics show, called out by Endres, in average afro-americansAfro-Americans people won't get a better diploma than white people in the US.
And the last thing she mentions is that even if black people get a good diploma there is a lack of opportunities and they are often jobless.
Endres supports this by saying, that a quarter of black people in the USA are poor.
After giving you this information I wanted to ask you about your opinion on how the problem is perceived here in europeEurope.
If you have any questions don't hesitate to call me.
